main event: A bright silver, round object about 4 feet across was observed flying a straight and level course until it faded below the horizon near Luther, Michigan on February 3, 1956.
interesting points: The object was observed for 20-30 minutes.
The object was observed at an elevation of 22 degrees and an azimuth of 352-359 degrees.
The observer was a ground-visual witness watching for aircraft.
The weather was clear at the time of the sighting.
The report concludes the object was possibly a balloon, but also states there was insufficient data to support this evaluation.
sighted object: one bright silver, round object about 4 feet across
witnesses: a ground observer watching for aircraft
